## Reference Materials

This page provides additional learning resources to supplement the course materials.

### Textbooks and Online References

#### Machine Learning Foundations
* [Elements of Statistical Learning](https://hastie.su.domains/ElemStatLearn/) by Hastie, Tibshirani, and Friedman
* [Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/uploads/prod/2006/01/Bishop-Pattern-Recognition-and-Machine-Learning-2006.pdf) by Christopher Bishop
* [Introduction to Statistical Learning](https://www.statlearning.com/) by James, Witten, Hastie, and Tibshirani

#### Deep Learning
* [Deep Learning](https://www.deeplearningbook.org/) by Goodfellow, Bengio, and Courville
* [Neural Networks and Deep Learning](http://neuralnetworksanddeeplearning.com/) by Michael Nielsen
* [Dive into Deep Learning](https://d2l.ai/) - Interactive book with code examples

#### Probabilistic Machine Learning
* [Probabilistic Machine Learning: An Introduction](https://probml.github.io/pml-book/book1.html) by Kevin Murphy
* [Bayesian Reasoning and Machine Learning](http://web4.cs.ucl.ac.uk/staff/D.Barber/pmwiki/pmwiki.php?n=Brml.HomePage) by David Barber

### Online Courses and Tutorials

#### General Machine Learning
* [Stanford CS229: Machine Learning](https://cs229.stanford.edu/) - Andrew Ng's course with lecture notes and materials
* [Cornell CS4780: Machine Learning for Intelligent Systems](https://www.cs.cornell.edu/courses/cs4780/2018fa/lectures/) - Kilian Weinberger's lectures
* [MIT 6.867: Machine Learning](https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-867-machine-learning-fall-2006/) - MIT OpenCourseWare

#### Deep Learning
* [Stanford CS231n: Convolutional Neural Networks for Visual Recognition](http://cs231n.stanford.edu/) - Excellent resource for computer vision
* [Stanford CS224n: Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning](http://web.stanford.edu/class/cs224n/) - Deep dive into NLP
* [Fast.ai](https://www.fast.ai/) - Practical deep learning courses

### Tutorials, Libraries, and Tools

#### Python Libraries and Tools
* [scikit-learn](https://scikit-learn.org/stable/tutorial/index.html) - Comprehensive machine learning in Python
* [TensorFlow Tutorials](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials) - Official TensorFlow documentation
* [PyTorch Tutorials](https://pytorch.org/tutorials/) - Official PyTorch documentation
* [NumPy](https://numpy.org/doc/stable/user/tutorials_index.html) - Foundation for scientific computing in Python
* [Pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/getting_started/index.html) - Data manipulation and analysis

#### Visualization Tools
* [Matplotlib](https://matplotlib.org/stable/tutorials/index.html) - Comprehensive visualization library
* [Seaborn](https://seaborn.pydata.org/tutorial.html) - Statistical data visualization
* [Plotly](https://plotly.com/python/getting-started/) - Interactive visualizations

#### Specialized Topics
* [Hugging Face](https://huggingface.co/docs/transformers/index) - State-of-the-art NLP models
* [Hands-on Reinforcement Learning](https://huggingface.co/learn/deep-rl-course/unit0/introduction) - RL course by Hugging Face
* [Geometric Deep Learning](https://geometricdeeplearning.com/) - Advanced ML on non-Euclidean domains

## Research Paper Collections

### Foundational Papers
* [Gradient-Based Learning Applied to Document Recognition](http://vision.stanford.edu/cs598_spring07/papers/Lecun98.pdf) - LeNet by Yann LeCun
* [ImageNet Classification with Deep Convolutional Neural Networks](https://papers.nips.cc/paper/2012/file/c399862d3b9d6b76c8436e924a68c45b-Paper.pdf) - AlexNet paper
* [Attention Is All You Need](https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.03762) - Transformer architecture

### Recent Impactful Papers
* [Language Models are Few-Shot Learners](https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.14165) - GPT-3 paper
* [High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models](https://arxiv.org/abs/2112.10752) - Stable Diffusion
* [An Image is Worth 16x16 Words: Transformers for Image Recognition at Scale](https://arxiv.org/abs/2010.11929) - Vision Transformer (ViT)

### Paper Discussion Groups
* [Papers with Code](https://paperswithcode.com/) - Papers with implementations
* [Two Minute Papers](https://www.youtube.com/c/K%C3%A1rolyZsolnai) - Quick explanations of recent papers
* [ML Explained](https://www.youtube.com/c/MLExplained) - In-depth explanations of ML papers

## Interactive Learning Resources

### Notebooks and Interactive Demos
* [Distill.pub](https://distill.pub/) - Clear explanations of machine learning concepts
* [Tensorflow Playground](https://playground.tensorflow.org/) - Neural network visualization
* [GAN Lab](https://poloclub.github.io/ganlab/) - Interactive GAN experiments

### Challenges and Competitions
* [Kaggle Competitions](https://www.kaggle.com/competitions) - Data science competitions
* [DrivenData](https://www.drivendata.org/) - ML competitions for social impact
* [AIcrowd](https://www.aicrowd.com/) - ML challenges and benchmarks

## Career Development

### Job Search Resources
* [Machine Learning Jobs](https://www.indeed.com/q-Machine-Learning-jobs.html) - Indeed job listings
* [AI Jobs](https://ai-jobs.net/) - Specialized AI/ML job board
* [ML/AI Graduate Programs](https://www.mastersindatascience.org/specialties/machine-learning-degree/) - Guide to graduate programs

### ML in Industry
* [Papers from Industry](https://github.com/eugeneyan/applied-ml) - Collection of ML applications
* [Production ML Systems](https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/crash-course/production-ml-systems) - Google's guide to ML in production
* [AI Ethics Guidelines](https://www.fast.ai/ethics) - Ethical considerations in AI
